com.jdroid.android.billing
Class BillingResponseHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.jdroid.android.billing.BillingResponseHandler

public class BillingResponseHandler
extends Object

This class contains the methods that handle responses from the Google Play app. An application might also want to forward some responses on to its own server.

checkBillingSupportedResponse

public static void checkBillingSupportedResponse(BillingResponseCode responseCode)
Notifies the application of the availability of the MarketBillingService. This method is called in response to the application calling BillingManager.checkBillingSupported().

Parameters:
responseCode - a response code from the Google Play app to indicate the state of the request

startMarketCheckoutActivity

public static void startMarketCheckoutActivity(android.app.PendingIntent pendingIntent,
                                               android.content.Intent intent)
Starts a new activity for the user to buy an item for sale. This method forwards the intent on to the PurchaseObserver (if it exists) because we need to start the activity on the activity stack of the application.

Parameters:
pendingIntent - a PendingIntent that we received from the Google Play app that will create the new buy page activity
intent - an intent containing a request id in an extra field that will be passed to the buy page activity when it is created

responseCodeReceived

public static void responseCodeReceived(BillingManagerImpl.RequestPurchase request,
                                        BillingResponseCode responseCode)
This is called when we receive a response code from the Google Play app for a RequestPurchase request that we made. This is used for reporting various errors and also for acknowledging that an order was sent successfully to the server. This is NOT used for any purchase state changes. All purchase state changes are received in the BillingReceiver and are handled in Security.verifyPurchase(String, String).

Parameters:
request - the RequestPurchase request for which we received a response code
responseCode - a response code from the Google Play app to indicate the state of the request

responseCodeReceived

public static void responseCodeReceived(BillingManagerImpl.RestoreTransactions request,
                                        BillingResponseCode responseCode)
This is called when we receive a response code from the Google Play app for a RestoreTransactions request.

Parameters:
request - the RestoreTransactions request for which we received a response code
responseCode - a response code from the Google Play app to indicate the state of the request

notifyPurchaseStateChanged

public static void notifyPurchaseStateChanged(List<PurchaseOrder> orders)
Notifies the application of purchase state changes. The application can offer an item for sale to the user via BillingManager.requestPurchase(Purchasable, String). The BillingService calls this method after it gets the response. Another way this method can be called is if the user bought something on another device running this same app. Then the Google Play app notifies the other devices that the user has purchased an item, in which case the BillingService will also call this method. Finally, this method can be called if the item was refunded.

Parameters:
orders -
